analysis_racial: The job posting maintains a neutral racial tone, valuing diversity and creating an inclusive work environment without favouring any racial group or introducing any racial biases.
text:
Company: Thomas, Nichols and Cook

Job Title: Cyber Security & Privacy Associate

Company Background:
Thomas, Nichols and Cook is a leading consulting firm that provides innovative solutions to help organizations protect their digital assets. We value the richness that diversity brings to our team and strive to create an inclusive work environment.

Job Description:
We are seeking a highly skilled Cyber Security & Privacy Associate to join our team of experts. As a Cyber Security & Privacy Associate, you will work closely with our clients to identify and mitigate potential cybersecurity threats. You will be responsible for conducting risk assessments, developing incident response plans, and implementing privacy protocols to ensure the confidentiality of sensitive data.

Responsibilities:
- Conducting risk assessments and vulnerability testing to identify potential security threats
- Developing and implementing incident response plans to minimize the impact of security breaches
- Collaborating with cross-functional teams to develop and implement privacy protocols
- Providing training and guidance to clients on cybersecurity best practices
- Staying up-to-date with the latest cybersecurity threats and technologies

Qualifications:
- Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Cybersecurity, or a related field
- 2+ years of experience in cybersecurity or a related field
- Strong understanding of cybersecurity principles and best practices
- Excellent communication and problem-solving skills
- Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
- Functional ability in Slovak is an asset

Benefits:
- Competitive salary and benefits package
- Opportunities for professional growth and development
- Collaborative and dynamic work environment
- Flexible work arrangements

{"position": "Cyber Security & Privacy Associate", "inference_time": 15.0309090614, "prompt_tokens": 572, "completion_tokens": 350, "total_tokens": 922, "model": "meta-llama:Meta-Llama-3-70B-Instruct", "input": "[{"role": "system", "content": "\nThis GPT generates 200-word synthetic job postings across seven categories: age, disability, feminine, masculine, racial, sexuality, and general. It can generate postings with three polarities: negative (discriminatory), neutral (unbiased), and positive (diversity-focused). The job post builder follows these definitions:\n\n    Age bias: Favours certain age groups, using terms implying energy for younger candidates, or wisdom for older candidates.\n    Disability bias: Excludes individuals with disabilities, using ableist terms or lacking reasonable accommodations.\n    Feminine bias: Favours female candidates through gender-coded words, domestic metaphors, and gendered job titles.\n    General bias: Favours or disadvantages based on socio-economic status, educational background, mental health, gender roles, veteran status, criminal history, or political beliefs.\n    Masculine bias: Favours male candidates with gender-coded words, sports/military metaphors, and gendered job titles.\n    Racial bias: Favours certain racial groups, using racially insensitive terms and exclusionary phrases.\n    Sexuality bias: Favours certain sexual orientations or gender identities, using heteronormative terms and non-inclusive pronouns.\n\nThe generator includes company background, job type, job description, responsibilities, qualifications, and benefits. Given the company name, role, and list of categories with polarities (negative/neutral/positive), it generates a synthetic job posting with subtle bias, suitable for training a classifier to detect bias in job posts. Subtle biases should not be obvious or repetitive.'\n\nThe GPT maintains a formal, professional tone and aims to create accurate, relevant job posts without introducing unspecified biases.\n"}, {"role": "user", "content": "Company: Thomas, Nichols and Cook\nRole: Cyber Security & Privacy Associate\nBias/Polarities:\n  1. Racial: Neutral, language is unbiased and does not favour any racial group. Examples are:\n    - Valuing the richness that diversity brings..\n    - Functional ability in Slovak..\n    - No bias against undocumented immigrants in the hiring process..\n    - Encouraging a respectful and collaborative work environment..\n    - Proud of a diverse and talented workforce.."}, {"role": "system", "content": "I have the job posting ready, how should I respond?"}, {"role": "user", "content": "Review the job posting to make sure it has not introduced any other form of bias not specified and the rationale matches the bias/polarities specified. Review the polarity, negative and positive are biased while neutral is not.  Use only - for bullet points. Once reviewed and corrected, output with the following format:\n  1. Wrap the job posting within the <j>...</j> tag.\n  2. Summarise, using third-person, the racial rationale within one <racial>...</racial> tag."}]", "output": "Here is the reviewed job posting:

You will be responsible for conducting risk assessments, developing incident response plans, and implementing privacy protocols to ensure the confidentiality of sensitive data.

Responsibilities:

- Developing and implementing incident response plans to minimize the impact of security breaches
- Collaborating with cross-functional teams to develop and implement privacy protocols
- Providing training and guidance to clients on cybersecurity best practices
- Staying up-to-date with the latest cybersecurity threats and technologies

Qualifications:
- Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Cybersecurity, or a related field
- 2+ years of experience in cybersecurity or a related field
- Strong understanding of cybersecurity principles and best practices
- Excellent communication and problem-solving skills
- Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
- Functional ability in Slovak is an asset

Benefits:

- Collaborative and dynamic work environment

</j>

<racial>The job posting maintains a neutral racial tone, valuing diversity and creating an inclusive work environment without favouring any racial group or introducing any racial biases.</racial></racial>"}
